text: Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It’s about learning to dance in the rain.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

text: Everything that’s broken was beautiful at one time. And our mistakes make us better people.
author: Jamie Hoang

text: I can’t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: No matter what you’re going through, there’s a light at the end of the tunnel.
author: Demi Lovato

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving. Out of difficulties grow miracles.
author: William James

text: Nothing is impossible. The word itself says: ‘I’m possible!'
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: You’re braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A. A. Milne

text: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

text: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
author: Og Mandino

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Failure is success in progress.
author: Albert Einstein

text: If I cannot do great things, I can do small things in a great way.
author: Martin Luther King Jr

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
author: Bill Bradley

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Successful men and women keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don’t quit..
author: Conrad Hilton

text: Failure happens all the time. It happens every day in practice. What makes you better is how you react to it.
author: Mia Hamm

text: Giving up is for rookies.
author: Philoctetes

text: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

text: Part of being a champ is acting like a champ. You have to learn how to win and not run away when you lose.
author: Nancy Kerrigan

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: In every job that must be done, there is an element of fun. You find the fun and—snap!—the job’s a game!
author: Mary Poppins

text: It's just a game. Don't give up!
author: Nail Sharipov

text: If you fall behind, run faster. Never give up, never surrender, and rise up against the odds.
author: Jesse Jackson

text: Survival can be summed up in three words—never give up. That’s the heart of it really. Just keep trying.
author: Bear Grylls

text: I know from experience that you should never give up on yourself or others, no matter what.
author: George Foreman

text: There is no failure except in no longer trying.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Thank you to my wife, who wished to learn English.
author: Nail Sharipov

text: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Your victory is right around the corner. Never give up.
author: Nicki Minaj

text: I have not failed, I have just found 10,000 ways that won’t work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: It’s hard to beat a person who never gives up.
author: Babe Ruth

text: It’s not that I’m so smart, it’s just that I stay with problems longer.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Just because you fail once doesn’t mean you’re gonna fail at everything.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

text: If you run, you might lose. If you don’t run, you’re guaranteed to lose.
author: Jesse Jackson

text: Every master was once a disaster.
author: T.S. Wood
